title: Rate Limiter Service
subtitle: Production-Style Backend System
description: A microservice-ready rate limiter implemented in C++, designed for real backend usage with clean abstractions and fast request handling.
overview: Implements a configurable rate limiting service that can sit in front of APIs or services to control traffic based on user tiers and policies.
features: Config-driven rate limiting with startup-time loading
Lazy creation and reuse of limiter instances
Fast in-memory request path (no parsing or IO at runtime)
Support for multiple strategies: Fixed Window, Sliding Window, Token Bucket, Leaky Bucket
Clear separation of config, policy, factory, service, and algorithm layers

title: Parking Management System
subtitle: Low-Level Design Implementation
description: A clean object-oriented implementation of a parking lot system.
overview: Models real-world parking behavior: entry, slot allocation, ticketing, exit, pricing, payment, and slot release with well-defined boundaries.
